title: Living Literacy, Changing Lives: Citi Partners with Premier Business School LUMS for a Financial Capability-Building Program
summary: Citi and the Lahore University of Management Sciences have partnered once again on a Financial Capability and Asset Building Program for students who are part of LUMS' National Outreach Program, based on a $35,000 Citi Foundation grant. As part of this program, students from all across Pakistan participated in an intensive workshop, which included modules on the basics of banking, savings, managing money, concepts of credit and smart investments among other elements of financial capability and asset building. The program was based on the case-study method to provide students with maximum exposure to real-world situations.
tag-1: Living Literacy, Changing Lives: Citi Partners with Premier Business School LUMS for a Financial Capability-Building Program
tag-2: Citi and the Lahore University of Management Sciences have partnered once again on a Financial Capability and Asset Building Program for students who are part of LUMS' National Outreach Program, based on a $35,000 Citi Foundation grant. As part of this program, students from all across Pakistan participated in an intensive workshop, which included modules on the basics of banking, savings, managing money, concepts of credit and smart investments among other elements of financial capability and asset building. The program was based on the case-study method to provide students with maximum exposure to real-world situations.
tag-3: Speaking at the opening ceremony of the partnership, Citi's Head of Global Banking for Lahore, Salman Mian said: "It is truly inspiring to see so such a diverse range of students from across the nation participating in this program. Youth and financial education remain a key focal area for Citi's responsible finance efforts. We are hopeful that such a structured program that provides exposure to hands-on financial situations for university students will go a long way in improving economic conditions and livelihood opportunities for these extremely talented boys and girls."
tag-4: "Citi and LUMS have been longstanding partners and have collaborated extensively to strengthening responsible finance programs through both education and microentrepreneurship initiatives in Pakistan," said Arif Usmani, CCO & MD, Citi Pakistan. "As LUMS celebrates 25 years and Citi completes 50 years in Pakistan this year, we have collaborated once more to provide hands-on trainings through a dedicated case-study based workshop on the 'Basics of Banking' and the concepts of savings, investments, borrower-ethics and credit amongst other vital financial instruments. We will be concluding this program through a thought-leadership conference in September and are optimistic that this initiative has contributed towards the intellectual capacity building and development of students from LUMS' National Outreach Program."
tag-5: As Citi Pakistan completes 50 years in the country (1961-2011), it continues to focus on developing financial education as a tool for financial inclusion and poverty alleviation in the community through a series of programs based on Citi Foundation funding. It has recently signed a partnership with LUMS for a nationwide program to create and improve linkages between academia and the professional world, so as to positively impact futures for our youth.
tag-6: Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
